Hi everyone,

We've designed CTAs to appear on our blog pages. Simple banners with buttons to break up the content and direct users to our main offerings. We designed versions for both desktop and mobile.

I've built these as 'embedded CTAs'. My issues is that I can't see a way to hide the desktop version on mobile and vice versa.

I spoke with HubSpot support and they said it would need to be custom coded. I'm hoping that there's a line of code that can be added to the CTA to state 'show only on desktop / mobile' but don't know if that's possible

Does anyone know if this is possible and what the code should be?

Add this CSS to your page or stylesheet to control when each CTA is shown or hidden:

`/* Hide mobile CTA on screens wider than 768px (tablets and desktops) */`
`.cta-mobile {`
    `display: none;`
`}`

`@media only screen and (max-width: 768px) {`
    `/* Show mobile CTA on smaller screens */`
    `.cta-mobile {`
        `display: block;`
    `}`
    `/* Hide desktop CTA on smaller screens */`
    `.cta-desktop {`
        `display: none;`
    `}`
`}`

`@media only screen and (min-width: 769px) {`
    `/* Show desktop CTA on wider screens */`
    `.cta-desktop {`
        `display: block;`
    `}`
`}`


• *`.cta-mobile`* is hidden by default and only becomes visible on screens with a max width of 768px (generally mobile).
• *`.cta-desktop`* is only visible on screens wider than 768px (you can change that as required).
• *If you’re using inline styles* in HubSpot: You may need to add this CSS to the global stylesheet or directly to the HTML/CSS module where your CTAs are embedded.
• *HubSpot Design Manager*: You can also add this custom CSS directly in the page’s CSS settings if that’s easier.
Thanks so much Ahmed, I'll try that now!
Sorry, one more question, do I need to add .cta-mobile / .cta-desktop to the code of the CTAs? If so, where would be best to add that?

You're most welcome Andrew :slightly_smiling_face:

Yes, you’ll need to add the `.cta-mobile` and `.cta-desktop` classes directly to the HTML elements of your CTAs. This way the CSS can identify each version and apply the correct styling to show or hide them based on the screen size.

heys guys, I need help with the following.

I need to create a pipeline for some externals, partner  users.

and I want these users to have access to that specific pipeline only, nothing else.

I restricted their permission but they can still see payments, etc

What is the best approach to achieve what I need?

Make sure Payments and other sensitive data are not included in the access level for their role.

You can also leverage HS Teams if you have pro or enterprise. Remember to also set permissions for CRM objects to “Team only” or “Owned only”.
Another point, in the role permissions, restrict access to sensitive areas i.e: any other sections you don’t want these users to see.
